articles.headline: Media Executives Flock to Sun Valley Conference
articles.snippet: Moguls like Warren Buffett and the founders of Google are in Idaho this week for the Sun Valley Conference.
articles.abstract: Moguls like Warren Buffett and the founders of Google are in Idaho this week for the Sun Valley Conference.
articles.lead_paragraph: SUN VALLEY, Idaho  Gulfstreams and Falcons. Buffett and Brin. Angling for trout and ice skating to “Bad Romance.”
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Judge Topples U.S. Rejection of Gay Unions
articles.snippet: The federal judge ruled that gay and lesbian couples deserve the same federal benefits as heterosexual couples.
articles.abstract: The federal judge ruled that gay and lesbian couples deserve the same federal benefits as heterosexual couples.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON  A federal judge in Massachusetts found Thursday that a law barring the federal government from recognizing same-sex marriage is unconstitutional, ruling that gay and lesbian couples deserve the same federal benefits as heterosexual couples.
articles.byline: By Abby Goodnough and John Schwartz

articles.headline: Greece Approves Pension Overhaul Despite Protests
articles.snippet: The plan represents the beginning of the end of the cradle-to-grave state compact begun in the early 1980s.
articles.abstract: The plan represents the beginning of the end of the cradle-to-grave state compact begun in the early 1980s.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS  Greece took a big step toward overhauling its debt-plagued economy on Thursday by forcing through a pension bill that would sharply pare down the country’s welfare state by increasing the retirement age and reducing benefits.
articles.byline: By Landon Thomas Jr. and Niki Kitsantonis

articles.headline: Biggest Defaulters on Mortgages Are the Rich
articles.snippet: The well-to-do have stopped paying their home loans in greater numbers, and apparently with less guilt.
articles.abstract: The well-to-do have stopped paying their home loans in greater numbers, and apparently with less guilt.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ALTOS, Calif.  No need for tears, but the well-off are losing their master suites and saying goodbye to their wine cellars.

articles.headline: Smugglers in Iraq Blunt Sanctions Against Iran
articles.snippet: One of the biggest gaps in the American strategy is on full display in Iraq, where millions of dollars in crude oil are smuggled from Kurdistan every year.
articles.abstract: One of the biggest gaps in the American strategy is on full display in Iraq, where millions of dollars in crude oil are smuggled from Kurdistan every year.
articles.lead_paragraph: PENJWIN, Iraq — Even as the United States imposes new sanctions on Iran, one of the biggest gaps in the American strategy is on full display here in Iraq, where hundreds of millions of dollars in crude oil and refined products are smuggled over the scenic mountains of Iraqi Kurdistan every year.

articles.headline: Opening a Big Store in China, Apple Remains a Market Underdog
articles.snippet: With a new flagship showroom about to open, the company is striving to overcome price disadvantages and an underground market.
articles.abstract: With a new flagship showroom about to open, the company is striving to overcome price disadvantages and an underground market.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  Although Apple is widely admired in China, most fans of its products here have been buying their iPhones, iPods and Mac computers from smugglers who operate through underground electronics markets.

articles.headline: Smartphone Patent Suits Challenge Big Makers
articles.snippet: NTP charges that the cellphone e-mail systems of the companies are illegally using its patented technology.
articles.abstract: NTP charges that the cellphone e-mail systems of the companies are illegally using its patented technology.
articles.lead_paragraph: NTP, a patent-holding company best known for prying a settlement of more than $600 million from the maker of the BlackBerry, is now suing the other big names in the smartphone industry: Apple, Google, Microsoft, HTC, LG and Motorola.

articles.headline: Swap Idea Emerged Early in Case of Russia Agents
articles.snippet: Before 10 Russian agents were arrested, the Obama administration saw a prisoner exchange as a way to avoid undercutting an attempt to rebuild Russian-American relations.
articles.abstract: Before 10 Russian agents were arrested, the Obama administration saw a prisoner exchange as a way to avoid undercutting an attempt to rebuild Russian-American relations.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Peter Baker, Charlie Savage and Benjamin Weiser and written by Mr. Baker.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Charlie Savage and Benjamin Weiser

articles.headline: China Renews Google’s License
articles.snippet: The renewal, which allows Google to continue to operate in China, ended months of tensions over censorship.
articles.abstract: The renewal, which allows Google to continue to operate in China, ended months of tensions over censorship.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  The tense standoff that began in January with Google’s unprecedented rebuke of China’s Internet censorship rules appeared to ease on Friday with a compromise that might allow both sides to claim a partial victory.
articles.byline: By David Barboza and Miguel Helft
